tools.name: amazon_supply_chain_fba_list_replenish_asap
tools.description:
List items that need to be replenished to FBA ASAP based on projected stockout risk and inbound coverage.

Inputs are a flat JSON object (no nested sku_selector).

Recommended defaults (confirm with user):
- planning_base: actively_sold_only
- time_window.lookahead_days: 14
- sales_velocity: current
- use_seasonality: true
- override_default: false (so table defaults are used)
- days_between_shipments: 14 (aka reorder cadence)
- stockout_threshold_days: 7
- limit: 50

Common questions to ask the user:
- Which marketplaces/countries should we include? (default: ALL)
- Do you want actively sold only (default), all, or a targeted subset?
- Should results be limited to a specific company_id (if you have multiple)?

Knowledge base (methodology & definitions): https://help.neonpanel.com/en/articles/60
Inventory Planning report (UI): https://my.neonpanel.com/app/reports/forecasting/inventory-planning

planning_base.description: Which universe of SKUs/items to consider. Recommended default: actively_sold_only. Use targeted_only with target_* filters.

target_skus.description: Optional: restrict to specific SKUs. Recommended when planning_base=targeted_only.

target_inventory_ids.description: Optional: restrict to specific inventory IDs. Recommended when planning_base=targeted_only.

target_asins.description: Optional: restrict to specific ASINs. Recommended when planning_base=targeted_only.

brand.description: Optional brand filter (exact match as stored in snapshot).

category.description: Optional category filter (exact match as stored in snapshot).

marketplaces.description: Marketplace filter. If you provide both ALL and specific marketplaces, ALL is ignored. If you set countries, countries takes precedence over marketplaces.

countries.description: Optional explicit country/country_code filter. Takes precedence over marketplaces when non-empty.

company_id.description: Optional: restrict to a specific permitted company_id. If omitted, uses all permitted companies.

lookahead_days.description: How many days ahead to evaluate stockout risk. Recommended default: 14. Ask the user if they want a different horizon (e.g., 7/14/30).

as_of_date.description: Optional. Evaluate as of a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). If omitted, the latest available snapshot date is used.

time_window.description: Time window settings. Ask the user to confirm lookahead_days and (optionally) as_of_date.

sales_velocity.description: Which sales velocity to use for projections. Recommended default: current.

use_seasonality.description: Whether to apply seasonality adjustments (if available in the snapshot). Recommended default: true.

override_default.description: If true, use fba_lead_time_days_override and fba_safety_stock_days_override instead of table defaults.

fba_lead_time_days_override.description: Only used when override_default=true. Lead time (days) to use for FBA replenishment planning. Recommended default: 12 (confirm with user).

fba_safety_stock_days_override.description: Only used when override_default=true. Safety stock buffer expressed in days of coverage. This is treated as a MINIMUM required buffer (higher = more conservative). Recommended default: 60 (confirm with user).

days_between_shipments.description: Reorder cadence (synonym: days_between_shipments). Used to ensure inventory stays covered until the next replenishment cycle. This is added to lead_time + safety_stock coverage when computing shipment_due_* and recommended_ship_units. Recommended default: 14 (confirm with user).

limit.description: Max number of rows to return. Recommended default: 50.

stockout_threshold_days.description: Threshold (days to OOS) for classifying urgency. Recommended default: 7.

active_sold_min_units_per_day.description: Only affects planning_base=actively_sold_only. Minimum average daily units (30-day basis) required to include an item as 'actively sold'. Default 1 means ~1 unit/day. Example: 100 means only items selling ~100/day or more are considered actively sold.

company_id.description: Company id for the row (helps validate filtering and client-side rendering).

item_ref.description: Canonical item reference. Include at least one identifier. Prefer to include item_icon_url in tool outputs to avoid extra requests.

item_icon_url.description: Small icon/image URL for item; include in datasets when possible.

presentation.description: UI-agnostic presentation payload. Clients can render links/images consistently. Links specify which identifier they are derived from.

sales_velocity.description: Units/day used for planning and recommendations (based on the selected sales_velocity input).

fba_days_of_supply.description: Computed days of supply at the selected sales velocity (fba_available / sales_velocity).

shipment_due_date.description: Date the replenishment shipment is due (clamped to today if overdue). Based on CURRENT_DATE + shipment_due_in_days.

shipment_due_in_days.description: Days until shipment is due. Negative means overdue. Computed as days_of_supply - (lead_time + safety_stock).

recommended_by_amazon_replenishment_quan.description: Raw recommendation from Amazon (snapshot field recommended_replenishment_qty), renamed for clarity. This is NOT the tool's computed recommendation.

examples.name: Recommended defaults (broad)
examples.description: Use recommended defaults and all marketplaces.

examples.name: Targeted SKUs (US only)
examples.description: Target a small SKU list and restrict to US.

tools.name: amazon_supply_chain_inventory_po_schedule
tools.description:
Schedule purchase orders (POs) by estimating when an item needs a new PO to maintain coverage through lead time + safety stock + PO cadence. Uses the latest inventory planning snapshot partition.

Defaults:
- sales_velocity: planned (sales plan)
- days_between_pos: 30
- limit: 50

Available inventory used for coverage:
- available_inventory_units = total_balance_quantity + total_ordered_quantity + available
- inbound is NOT counted.

planning_base.description: Which universe of items to consider. Recommended default: actively_sold_only. Use targeted_only with target_* filters.

target_inventory_ids.description: Optional: restrict to specific inventory IDs.

brand.description: Optional brand filter (exact match as stored in snapshot).

category.description: Optional category filter (exact match as stored in snapshot).

marketplaces.description: Marketplace filter. If you provide both ALL and specific marketplaces, ALL is ignored. If you set countries (non-empty), countries takes precedence over marketplaces.

countries.description: Optional explicit country/country_code filter. Takes precedence over marketplaces when non-empty.

company_id.description: Optional: restrict to a specific permitted company_id. If omitted, uses all permitted companies.

sales_velocity.description: Which sales velocity to use for projections. Default: planned.

use_seasonality.description: Whether to apply seasonality adjustments (reserved for future; currently not applied in SQL).

override_default.description: If true, use lead_time_days_override and safety_stock_days_override instead of table defaults.

lead_time_days_override.description: Only used when override_default=true. Lead time (days) to use for PO planning.

safety_stock_days_override.description: Only used when override_default=true. Safety stock buffer expressed in days of coverage (minimum buffer).

days_between_pos.description: PO cadence (days between POs). Added to lead_time + safety_stock coverage when computing po_due_* and recommended_order_units. Default: 30.

limit.description: Max number of rows to return.

stockout_threshold_days.description: Threshold for classifying urgency (po_due_in_days <= threshold => critical).

active_sold_min_units_per_day.description: Only affects planning_base=actively_sold_only. Minimum daily units to treat item as actively sold (30-day basis).

examples.name: Recommended defaults (broad)
examples.description: Use recommended defaults and all marketplaces for permitted companies.

examples.name: Single company (US)
examples.description: Restrict to a single permitted company_id and US marketplace.

tools.name: amazon_supply_chain_inventory_sku_deep_dive
tools.description:
Inventory SKU deep dive (raw snapshot inspection). Returns raw inventory_planning_snapshot row(s) from the latest snapshot partition for the authorized company_id(s).

How to use:
- Best: provide sku + marketplace (US/UK) to inspect a specific item.
- If you omit sku and/or marketplace, the tool will return a small sample of rows (useful to confirm snapshot data exists and to see exact country labels / SKU formatting).

Before calling this tool:
1) Ask the user if they want a specific SKU + marketplace or just a sample row for validation.
2) Optionally ask if they want to restrict to a specific company_id (recommended if they have access to multiple companies).

Knowledge base: https://help.neonpanel.com/en/articles/60
Inventory Planning report (UI): https://my.neonpanel.com/app/reports/forecasting/inventory-planning

When presenting results (important):
- Render item_ref.item_icon_url as an image when possible.
- Present a clean summary first (SKU, marketplace, inventory_id, company_id, snapshot date).
- Then show the raw snapshot fields grouped logically (inventory, sales, inbound, planning, lead time/safety stock).

sku.description: Optional. The SKU to inspect. If omitted, returns sample rows.

marketplace.description: Optional. Marketplace/country code (maps to snapshot column pil.country_code). If omitted, returns sample rows and lets you see available country labels.

company_id.description: Optional: restrict to a specific company_id (must be permitted). Recommended if you have access to multiple companies.

limit.description: Optional. Max rows to return if multiple rows match the SKU+marketplace. Recommended default: 5.

debug.description: Optional. If true, include diagnostics to explain why rows might be missing (authorized company_ids, chosen snapshot partition, available countries for the SKU).

item_icon_url.description: Small icon/image URL for item; render as an image when presenting results.

sales_forecast_scenario.description: Sales forecast scenario metadata for this snapshot row.

presentation.description: UI-agnostic presentation payload. Clients can render links/images consistently. Links specify which identifier they are derived from.

snapshot.description: Raw inventory_planning_snapshot columns for this SKU+marketplace row. Shape depends on the snapshot schema.

diagnostics.description: Included when debug=true or when no rows are found. Helps troubleshoot authorization / snapshot partition / marketplace mismatches.

sample_row_present.description: Whether the selected latest snapshot partition contains any rows for the authorized company_ids.

sample_country.description: A sample country value from the selected partition (helps confirm expected marketplace labels).

examples.name: Single SKU (US)
examples.description: Inspect the latest snapshot row for a SKU in US marketplace.

tools.name: amazon_supply_chain_product_list_logistic_parameters
tools.description:
List product logistics parameters (vendor, product spec/name for POs, dimensions, box params, MOQ) from the latest inventory planning snapshot.

Inputs (choose one):
- Provide inventory_ids (best when you already know the inventory IDs), OR
- Provide sku + company_id (best when you only know the SKU).

Notes:
- Data is read from the latest available inventory_planning_snapshot partition for the callerâ€™s permitted companies.

inventory_ids.description: Provide a list of inventory_id values to look up logistics parameters for. Use this OR sku+company_id.

sku.description: Provide a SKU to look up logistics parameters for. Requires company_id. Use this OR inventory_ids.

company_id.description: Required when using sku. Must be a company_id permitted for the caller.

limit.description: Safety limit for returned rows. If sku matches multiple marketplaces/rows, this caps the result size. Default: 200.

product_spec.description: Vendor-facing product specification/name used for purchase orders (often sourced from vendor_product_specs in NeonPanel).

examples.name: Lookup by inventory_ids
examples.description: Fetch logistics parameters for a known inventory_id set.

examples.name: Lookup by sku + company_id
examples.description: Fetch logistics parameters when you only know the SKU (requires company_id).
